pr_title: [core] Add type and format properties to model of inline response

timeline.bodyText: I wonder how to clone schema instance here. I need to change result of Json.pretty(schema); but keep original instance not modified.
timeline.author: ybelenko
jimschubert
jimschubert

timeline.bodyText: I've figured out Java debugger finally and found that InlineModelResolver strips data type here. That's my fix.
timeline.author: ybelenko

replies.bodyText: @ybelenko thanks for the fix. Do we need to set the format as well?
replies.author: wing328

replies.bodyText: @wing328 Yeas, I think so. It's not so critical as type, but it's weird that InlineModelResolver can cut off that field completely. I'll test it today, maybe format isn't missing.
replies.author: ybelenko

timeline.message: Save type of inline schema in modelJson prop
Add fix suggested by Jim Schubert

Revert "Add fix suggested by Jim Schubert"

This reverts commit 3a1951b62088836aa116444fffb90c83719b4927.

Revert "Save type of inline schema in modelJson prop"

This reverts commit f88dcb13594b3e21b734b8b1569ca29bcbf9cb13.
Add data formats to test spec
Save data format in inline models
